brewery.brewery_description:
HERE AT THE ALBERT BREWERY, WE ARE SERIOUS ABOUT LAGER. 
Brewed to be enjoyed by all, we offer a range of authentic lager beers that are meticulously made with passion and precision. 

From cold fermentation to natural conditioning, we focus on traditional techniques. While this approach takes time, we believe the finished product is worth the wait. 

Clean, balanced and refreshing, our lagers will make you wonder where The Albert Brewery has been your entire life.

location.venue_address: 41-59 Sims St, West Melbourne VIC 3003, Australia

items.badge_description: Looking for more kick than a session beer, but want to be able to stay for a few rounds? You have to keep it in the middle. That's 360 beers with an ABV greater than 5% and less than 10%.  Try 5 more for Level 73!

Porters and Stouts are rich with both history and flavor. Roasty, dark, and delicious, these two styles helped start it all. That’s 130 different beers with the style of Porter or Stout. Try 5 more for Level 27!

items.checkin_comment: Best dark lager I’ve had by a mile. Not too stouty

beer.beer_description: The Albert Peach Sour. A traditional Berliner Wiesse which we have added peaches to in the beginning of the brewing process - which has really carried over to be an easy drinking summer beer.

items.badge_description: It’s been a long day and now it’s time for a reward. Crisp, tasty and refreshing, enjoy that delicious fruit beer! That's 50 different fruited beers. Try 5 more for Level 11!

The classic Berliner Weisse is crisp, cloudy, and sour. Once the most popular beer style in Berlin, it's gained notoriety and popularity around the globe making us all proud to be Berliners. That's 5 different beers with the style of Berliner Weisse. Try 5 more for Level 2!

beer.beer_description: A refreshing, full flavoured lager with light bitterness. Pale straw in colour with upfront sweetness and a clean finish.

items.badge_description: Hell yea helles! This traditional German pale lager is typically full-bodied, mildly sweet, and light-colored, making it a perfect go to for any occasion. That's 20 different beers with the style of Lager - Helles or Bock - Maibock / Heller (Helles) / Lentebock. Try 5 more for Level 5!

beer.beer_description: Pale gold lager, with moderate hop bitterness and a dry finish. A classic, highly approachable pilsner.

items.badge_description: There's beer in them thar hills! You're setting off on your journey through the world of beer, but be sure to take a little time to get to know each brewery as you go. That's a beer from 395 different breweries. Try 5 more for Level 80!

beer.beer_description: Pale gold lager, with moderate hop bitterness and a dry finish. A classic, highly approachable pilsner.
A refreshing, full flavoured lager with light bitterness. Pale straw in colour with upfront sweetness and a clean finish.
A golden, full bodied lager at 3.5% ABV with a dry finish. An easy drinking, mid strength Australian lager.
A rich, dark lager with hints of toffee and chocolate. Reddish brown in colour with a subtle bitterness.
A dry, limited release black lager with lightly roasted flavours and a smooth finish.
A dry lager with strong bitterness from Czech hop additions. Pale gold in colour with spicy hop aroma and flavour.
A complex lager with bright amber hues. A soft bitterness with rich and toasty flavours.

Aromas of fresh pine and stone fruit, with subtle hints of citrus zest. On the palate robust pine and resin flavours are complemented by a strong, clean lingering bitterness. Cold fermentation leaves the finish exceptionally clean, allowing the hops to shine.

Albert White is a new limited addition brew. It's a perfect summer lager coming in at 4.0% ABV. We have taken inspiration from Belgium Witbeir and Japanese White beer flavours. It's a cloudy, white wheat lager with citrus and subtle spices. Smooth and sweet with a light bitterness.
A lightly hopped deep gold lager with a strong malty richness.
A smooth, full bodied lager with hints of red. Lightly roasted flavours with a moderate bitterness.
The Albert Peach Sour. A traditional Berliner Wiesse which we have added peaches to in the beginning of the brewing process - which has really carried over to be an easy drinking summer beer.
An unfiltered, Australian lager. Pale gold in colour with a medium bitterness and dry finish.
Albert Dry Lager! This crisp, clean, low-carb lager comes packed with subtle herbal vibes from German hops.
A smooth, rich lager with notes of roasted malts and burnt copper in colour. A mild warmth from the higher ABV.
